page.title: 12HOUSES IN RAMSGATE
page.content: Our sector covers the area from Ramsgate town centre to the south eastern edge of town.The town centre houses are almost all terraced ones more than a century old.In the middle area,the houses are still mainly terraced ones but quite large, 3 or 4 storeys high.Approaching the edge of town,most houses are 2 storeyed terraced ones,built around the 1880's Beyond this is an area of expensive detached houses built in the 1930's.On the edge of town is Nethercourt Estate, consisting of houses and bungalows built since the 1960's.The three newest estates, St.Benedicts Lawn,St.Augustines Park and the Convent Estate have all been built in recent years on land sold by the Roman Catholic Church.House prices have almost trebled in the past ten years. This area has no council houses.
